posts.title: Simple Guide to Find the Best Web Hosting Company To Host Your Blog
posts.content:
If you are in search of the best web hosting company for your site or blog then, doing some serious research is essential. With over 50,000 hosts, it can be quite tempting to choose the cheapest; but, over 90% of these web hosting companies won’t do the job right. Especially if you are paying with a credit card, and payments come out each month, you want to find the best web hosting company, not only for affordability but also for the best quality content you can get when you set up the blog.

Best Web Hosting Company

Here are some points that can help you to find the Best Web Hosting Company to host your blog:

Read: Make Your Content Go Viral-Secret Revealed

See what others have to say.

Like purchasing products, you have to find out about the company that you will have hosting your site. Using reviews, and finding out about the reputation of the web hosting company you are considering, is a simple solution to possibly choosing the wrong host, and having them develop a poor quality blog site for you.

Read: Blogger Vs WordPress – Which is Better And Why ?

See what experts think about the hosts.

Professionals offer another insight as to how good a web hosting company will be. Their opinion is unbiased and will give you honest information. If you know other bloggers, ask them as well; this provides a more personal perspective, while still getting the information you need. If you can visit professional blogs and reviews, this will greatly help you in the decision-making process.

Read: Beginner Blogger Mistake That New Blogger Should Avoid

Customer service of the host.

Finding out about how a web hosting company runs customer service is also crucial to choosing the right host. If it is a larger host, they generally have more employees and can handle issues that arise quickly. You want a web hosting company that responds quickly and will service any issues immediately, to ensure your blog is up and running as smoothly as possible, at all times.

Read: How To Get Google Adsense Approved Easily In 1 Day

Reputation: how is the host viewed by the public?

Google PR, Alexa, and other industry ranking tools are a great way to gauge whether or not you can trust a web hosting company, and what kind of quality services you can expect from them. Using this, along with other reviews will help you decide the best web hosting company, and will help you to avoid those that are not highly rated, and will give you an insight as to what you can expect, if you do eventually choose to work with that particular web hosting company for your online site and content.

Read: InfoLinks- Best Adsense Alternatives Make Money Easily

Offers: What does the best web hosting company provide?

Comparing the offers, free Adwords, free Facebook and social media feeds, domain name registration, and other coupon offers, will help you decide the best web hosting company. You want to find the best in terms of hosting and the work they do, but you also want to find affordability and the best pricing, when you are ready to choose the best web hosting company your online site.

Summary

Choosing the best web hosting company is as important as working hard and creating quality content for your blog. If you are spending countless hours creating content, and making the site look good, but choose a poor host, then many of the efforts that you put into that site, are never going to be fully seen by the public visitors.

posts.title: 10 Blogging Mistakes Beginner Blogger Should Avoid
posts.content:
Starting your first blog can be very exciting. However, your excitement can change into dullness if you are not aware of beginner blogger mistakes. Every blogger at some point makes mistake, either be it at the very beginning or any turnings. Learning from mistakes can help you recover but sometimes recovery from mistakes cannot fix everything. So, it’s better to avoid such beginner mistakes from the beginning of our blogging career. Here are some of the common mistakes beginner blogger mistakes should avoid.Making yourself aware of the common mistakes that beginner blogger makes can help you a lot and saves your time too.

Why Beginner Blogger Should read this post ?

  • So that you can learn from someone else mistakes.
  • So that you don’t repeat the same mistakes.
  • Make your blogging career strong from the beginning

Mistakes Beginner Blogger Should Avoid

1) Never Starting Your Blog.

This is one of the most common beginner mistakes. Many people start off excited about their new blog, even writing their first post. Then, they somehow become discouraged and never actually publish the content. If the content isn’t live, then it’s not a blog.

Read: Best Free WordPress Themes For Your WordPress Blog

2) Using Sub-Domains.

A sub-domain, such as yourblog.wordpress.com, tells readers that you’re not dedicated to your blog. Even if you decide to use a free blogging platform, like WordPress, blogger or TypePad, you should still use your own, dedicated URL. Before you begin, register your own domain name. Blogging from your own domain shows readers that you plan for your blog to be around for the long-haul.

3) Putting too much time into the design.

The design of your blog is nowhere near as important as its content. Your design does not create traffic. Your blog’s content does. So, don’t waste too much time worrying about the design itself. Go ahead and choose one of the numerous free templates, and start blogging. You will always have the option of changing your design later. Just make sure there’s enough relevant content available to attract search engines and readers to your blog.

Read: How To Increase Blog Traffic In Just a few days

4) Not Spreading the Word.

The hardest days will be the early days of your blog. You may begin to get frustrated because search engines simply aren’t indexing you, keeping your rankings low. Plus, no other bloggers seem to be linking to you or your content. It’s your job to spread the word about your blog. Start by informing your personal email contacts and making announcements on social networks. You can also search social media sites for groups who may have an interest in your industry and post there as well.

5) Giving Up Too Soon.

Building a valuable blog audience takes time, just like anything else worth doing. Many blog experts advise beginners to give their blogs 6 months to a year before expecting serious results. In the meantime, use this time to get to know your target audience, what piques their interests and what keeps their attention. The more you get to know them, the better you’ll learn to communicate with them.

Read: How To Get Google Adsense Approved Easily In 1 Day

6) Adding Too Many Widgets.

Once beginner bloggers discover how simple it is to add blog widgets, many get excited and go overboard. Resist the temptation to add numerous widgets in the beginning. Concentrate on creating valuable categories, blogrolls and content, as well as encouraging reader comments. The gadgets can be added later when you have more free time.

7) Monetizing Too Soon.

If you know anything about Google ads, you know how simple it is to throw them up on your blog. But, in the beginning, this may be a mistake. Until you build an audience, you’re optimised ads will only bring in pennies daily, if you’re lucky. Just stay focused on creating content that will build your audience for now. Optimisation can wait.

Read: Top 5 Best WordPress SEO Plugin For Higher Ranking

8) Not Being Original.

Plagiarism is a major, on-going issue with some beginner bloggers. They simply don’t understand how unprofessional and unethical it is to pass someone else’s writing off as your own. Your readers are savvy online users. They will notice your “stolen” content. And, guess what? Google and other search engines will too. Search engines will penalise you with low rankings, decreasing your traffic dramatically. So, make sure all of the content you publish is original. Both search engines, as well as your readers, will appreciate it.

9) Not Including Images.

Pictures brighten up just about any topic. They also help you illustrate things such as step-by-step instructions or processes. Images are even more valuable to long, wordy content. They help to break up the monotony of text, making the content more pleasing to the eyes. Plus, they make things seem more interesting. So, be sure to add relevant pics to your posts that include keywords for search engine optimisation.

Read: Secret Tips To Drive Facebook Traffic To Your Blog

10) Turning Off Comments.

Comments are one of the most valuable ways for your readers to interact with you. Some may post questions that catch the attention of others. You will also find many who will use the comments section to start interesting conversations, even if they’re controversial. Never take this privilege away from your readers. It tells them that you would like them to take interest in what you have to say. But, you’re in no way interested in their opinions or feelings. This decreases interactivity on your blog, which decreases your search engine rankings, and eventually, your traffic. So always keep a platform to engage with your readers. This builds good relation and trust with time.

Read: 5 Best Ways To Make Money From Your Blog

As I already said above, in blogging we all do mistakes, out of which some cost us a lot. But if we can avoid some common mistakes in the beginning then it’s very good. So I shared this article with you. I hope you liked it.

posts.title: Blogger Vs WordPress – Which is Better And Why ?
posts.content:
Blogger Vs WordPress- Which is better And Why? This is the question every new blogger wants to know. The answer sometimes can ve very complicated and sometimes as natural as farting. Blogger is a Google product which is free to use for everyone. WordPress is a free and open source CMS (Content Management System) software which you can use to create the website of your choice and little complicated compared to blogger. In this article, we will look over both blogger and wordPress and find out which one is the better choice and why? So let’s begin the battle of Blogger vs. WordPress.

Blogger Vs WordPress

Note: Here we are looking at  Blogger Vs WordPress,WordPress.org (Not WordPress.com).

Blogger (Blogspot)

It is a free platform for blogging by Google. It is perfect for a newbie. You don’t need to spend a single penny to start blogging on blogger platform. Just get a Gmail ID, Sign up for Blogspot, some setup, and your blog is ready. You have successfully created a blog for yourself. If you are new to blogging, I would recommend you stick with blogger, learn about blogging. It’s a zero cost learning platform.

Read: How to Create a free blog on Blogspot.com full Guide

As Google owns Blogspot, so you don’t have full rights and control over your blog. Google have the power to shut down your blog anytime. If you violate even a single policy of blogger, you are warned by Google and if this continues they will close down your blog.

Blogger has not an excellent collection of templates for your blog design.  The templates blogger provides are not very useful and attractive. If you can code then, you can customize your blog layout. There are some other third-party templates but very few, and they don not provide future support too.

There are many limitations in Blogspot. You don’t have control over the SEO of the blog, limited features, less customization, fewer supports. If you want to create a professional website or blog using Blogspot, you will end up crying and regretting. Blogspot is not for creating and or for the long-term site. It is for the beginner to learn how to blog.

One of the best thing about blogger is its security. As a part of Google, it has robust security. You don’t have to worry about anything regarding your blog’s safety.

WordPress

WordPress is a free CMS ( Content Management System). Starting with WordPress is little on the expensive side. Unlike blogger, you have to get a hosting server and a domain name like www.shoutmeloudblog.com to start a blog using WordPress. WordPress is a serious blogger platform as you will spend money on it. Nobody wants to waste their money.

Read: How to Install WordPress in Hostgator Full Guide

You have to spend money on your WordPress blog, host your files, and have full control and rights over your blog. It’s on you how long you want to run your blog and how to control all the information and data.

Modifying your blog is very easy. There are millions of paid as well as free Themes, plugins available with future support. You can design your blog according to your choice. Either you are creating a website for your business or a personal blog, WordPress has all the features and support you need.

Read: Top 5 Best Free WordPress Themes For Your Blog

Talking about limitations, there are very few. You get complete control over SEO, monitor and manage the SEO of your blog and make your blog more search engine friendly. You can use different plugins to boost the SEO of your blog. There are many other SEO techniques which you can use on your WordPress blog but not on the Blogspot blog. Here I have made a perfect list of SEO plugins for WordPress, read this out Best SEO plugins and tools for higher ranking.

Your blog is self-hosted, managed by you, controlled by you. So the security of the blog depends on you. You are responsible for the safety of your blog. You also need to backup your blog yourself. Self-hosted blogs are more vulnerable to be hacked. But you don’t need to worry. There are many plugins available for backup and security of your blog. You can use those plugin and improve the security.

Read: How to Improve Your wordPress Security

WordPress has a huge community. Support for the WordPress is limitless. If you ever get any problem or in trouble, you can easily get the solution. The online forums, documentations, chatrooms are very supportive and helpful. Go with WordPress if you are ready to spend some money and serious about blogging.

The interesting thing about WordPress blog is you can earn money through your self-hosted blog. Google Adsense, affiliate marketing are some the ways to make money from the blog. Here read about how to earn money from your blog.

If you ever decide to quit blogging, you can sell your blog at fantastic price bearing zero loss.

Conclusion

Blogger Vs WordPress, Blogger, is an awesome platform if you are new to blogging. You don’t need to have much technical knowledge to use blogger. It has a simple design with easy to use tools. If you don’t want to spend money and start your blog either for passion or learning, go with Blogspot. After being familiar with blogging slowly you can move to WordPress.

In the battle of Blogger Vs WordPress, WordPress is an advanced platform for blogging. You need to have some knowledge about blogging and some technical knowledge too. WordPress has a wide variety of features and a massive support in every step. If you are intermediate or serious blogger and want to make some money from blogging then go with WordPress.

posts.title: 10 Tips To Stop Customer Complaints and Boost Ecommerce Business
posts.content:
We are living in the social era where any right or bad news can be viral instantly. Bad news can create more ripples than good news and can leave long-lasting impacts. Therefore, eCommerce store owners are more immune towards bad reviews. Follow the tips below to Stop Customer Complaints Boost Ecommerce business.

Stop Customer Complaints Boost Ecommerce

It has seen that most of the bad reviews sprung from bad experiences on an e-commerce site or in customer services/supports, which are ultimately turned into consumer complaints. Fortunately, very few e-commerce shoppers or visitors directly write bad reviews while most of do complaints using appropriate channels instead.

It clearly indicates that if e-commerce owners cut the numbers of complaints, chances are high to raise the bar of overall performance and revenues as well. This post is about giving some wise tips or advice to stop consumer complaints before they are taking place, so let us go through.

Complain No.1: Where Is My Order?

This one is the most frequently occurring complaint in the e-commerce industry. Of course, it is the most sensitive one too because when your customer is placing an order and pay for it, she is placing a lot of trust in you.

Your shopper is now want to see her order as you had promised on your e-commerce store. If it is not arriving on-time and delays beyond tolerance, you surely face complaints from her.

At another facet of the coin, no e-commerce owner wishes to delay in fulfilment of order and take a significant risk. There are certain circumstances, which are responsible for delays in order deliveries for e-commerce as well as brick-and-mortar stores too.

Now, the question is that what is a viable solution for order related complaints?

You should keep your shoppers in the loop by offering order tracking facilities in your e-commerce storefront. You can do so by creating order tracking feature on your e-commerce website or integrating 3rd party software for reliable performance.

If you are using standard shipping agencies like USPS, you can integrate their APIs for real-time order status and for Map views to follow the journey of shipments or packages with live updates.

For international shipment with multiple shipping methods, you need to take help of Tracktor like apps, which are offering supports for hundreds of carriers across the globe.

Complain No.2: It is Not the Same Product that I have Seen on the Site

In brick-and-mortar stores, shoppers can touch, smell, see, and carry products/goods with physical sense, so they have no reason to express the lack of trust on their product purchases.

It is not in the case of e-commerce. The most unfortunate thing about e-commerce is that products are in virtual spaces, not in real or physical touch. Therefore, chances of arising discrepancies are high.

For instance, in the case of apparels the size, color, and fittings are known issues. You might have complaints regarding them. However, the remedy for such complaints are simple and it is product presentation in standard ways using the latest technologies.

You can use a professional photographer or can do photography in professional ways to take images of your product from various angles. Optimize photos using photo editor tools and upload those on your e-commerce web store.

The next important thing is writing product descriptions with the help of professional content writer or learn it to do professionally. Moreover, you can take help of modern multimedia tools such as an audio-visual presentation of products through videos, animation, and so on to augment your product different ways.

For instance, you can prepare video for how to use the product or how real life customers are using your products. These all efforts can build trusts among the users that they are receiving right products from right vendors.

The best policy for e-commerce owners is to be as transparent as possible and include various warnings regarding differences in display on their devices and actual products, particularly for colors, textures, and size of the products.

Complain No.3: Where Is Your Store or Warehouse Located?

Pure e-commerce stores have warehouses and brick-to-click stores have physical stores with warehouses. If you have a pure e-commerce store, you must mention your address of office and warehouses to establish trusts among the visitors at the first place.

If you have the brick-and-click store or e-commerce site with chains of physical stores, your contact details such as an address of the store, contact numbers, email address, and your shop registration number or taxation authority numbers are mandatory to mention on the e-commerce website.

It has multiple benefits in terms of the legal trust as well as convenience for your shoppers. It has seen that many local shoppers prefer to buy on an e-commerce site and pay for the goods, but prefer to pick up the order from physical stores through a face-to-face visit.

In such cases, full address and contact details with location map are the demand of today and it can please mobile users who love to drive straightly to the physical stores in their vicinity when they realize its products and quality online.

Complain No.4: I Cannot Find My Products Easily

Up to this, we have seen complaints regarding post-purchase phase. Now, we will see complaints regarding e-commerce site experiences, which are few in numbers expressed properly, otherwise, visitors avoid making complaints and simply leave your site to find your competitors.

If some genuine visitors express their dislikes directly to your contacts or in social media channels, you must be proactive and take it seriously to improve your performance.

Product search related complaints are common when an e-commerce store is devoid of the advance search feature and comprehensive navigation schemes. You have to incorporate both methods to find your products with a few clicks and fast loading of product or category pages.

Suggestive search, auto-search, faceted search, filtered search, and so on advanced search functionality integration in your in-site search engine is compulsory. Besides the main menu, you can include side menu, bottom menu, and breadcrumb like convenience for your shoppers to reach their desired products quickly.

Complain No.5: Product Shows Out-of-Stock Notification at the End of Checkout

It is an issue with the stock indication. Standard e-commerce platforms like Magento, WooCommerce, and others have built-in stock indicators in the latest versions while Shopify and many needs to add suitable extensions to depict inventory levels in comprehensive ways.

One interesting thing I would like to mention here that many customers place orders and after several days, they realize that the product is out of stock and may arrive after the certain time so they have to wait for it.

Yes, it is the hardcore reality in modern e-commerce where poor inventory management is responsible partially and display of inventory with real-time updates is for the rest. The best prevention measure is to use an app that can display out-of-stock notifications on product pages and during checkout process with alternatives to order for future delivery when inventory appears on the web store.

Stock indication helps e-commerce store in two different ways. At first place, it warns shoppers to place an order against no stock items to avoid frustrations at the end of checkout process. Another way, it offers an opportunity to place orders in advance for coming items, if your inventory management software is capable of delivering future data of stocks arriving on the web store.

Recently, partial payment/invoice system is working beautifully where instalments of full payment take some longer period and it is likely that new stock arrives on the store and e-commerce managers can deliver as soon as full payment is accomplishing.

Complain No.6: Shipping Cost Arrives at the End of Checkout Instead before Add-to-Cart

The majority of customers are eager to know the total cost of the products they purchase when the delivery men handover products in their hands. Many are like to do comparative shopping due to various promotional schemes running on the web with free shipping incentives.

Moreover, some are much savvy and would like to know the shipping carriers and their charges to pick up the best deal. Therefore, they look for shipping calculator right from the beginning of shopping or before adding products to shopping cart.

Today integrating shipping calculator is easy if you have seasoned team of e-commerce developers, and it the best remedy of such shipping cost related complaints. If you want to bring more transparency in your web store, show your shipping carriers along with charges. The best way is to have selection option for shipping methods too including shipping carriers.

Complain No.7: Your Store Has Obscure Terms & Condition

The aim behind writing terms and condition is to avoid conflict regarding e-commerce deals. It mainly includes the policies of e-commerce store in other words and defines how e-commerce web store like to build trusts among the users and establishes as well as nurture a long-term relationship with its patrons.

Therefore, it is advisable to keep your terms and condition transparent and visitor friendly. You must be easy enough to deal with for your visitors and secure to share critical data on your storefront including transaction data.

Complain No.8: What is Your Return Policies for Purchased Products

The modern e-commerce industry is using return policies as a marketing incentive and try to lure customers to keep their loyalty intact with them. Therefore, you may find ‘free of charge return’ headings in bold in many banners and e-commerce content.

However, offering free return is not possible in all circumstances and need to define well that whenever free return or return with flexible terms is possible. Of course, bearing return charges can reward you in the long run, as it is considering good user experiences on e-commerce.

Complain No.9: User Experiences of Your Website Are Not Good Enough

Have you visited a prestigious brick store in-person? If products are not classified in ranks and labelled properly, the store may seem a mess. You need to ask sales representative frequently and it can annoy service staff.

The same goes true in the case of e-commerce. When your visitors arrived in your virtual store, she may expect the same user experiences and usability. Therefore, it is better for you to plan easy and comprehensive navigation schemes to draw your target audience towards their goals/products.

Give them uncluttered and highly informative content. Use smart UI elements to convey your messages or intentions smartly. Design site architecture such a way that it makes screen transitions and screen flows smooth.

Therefore, you need to hire highly experienced and skilled e-commerce development team to achieve excellent user experiences.

Complain No.10: Your Site is Not Mobile Friendly

Recently, Google has included mobile friendliness as a ranking factor and alerted all website owners to either go for responsive web design (RWD) or dedicated mobile website development.

Apart from these, mobiles Internet has a huge audience, and the majority of shopping takes place through mobiles, via web browsers or apps. If you want to grab such lucrative opportunities available from a vast audience on mobiles, you must have your e-commerce store mobile friendly and responsive to give native mobile experiences using hardware and software capabilities of mobile devices including smartphones and tablets.

Test your website thoroughly on various smartphones and tablets with cross-device, cross-platform, and cross-browser compatibility, so your visitors have no room to make complaints regarding responsiveness or mobile friendliness of your e-commerce storefront.

Conclusion

Complaints on e-commerce stores are not a new thing. Many avoid it all while smart e-commerce owners are take it as an opportunity to improve the performance of storefront and their services to sustain in highly competitive environment online.

The best way to cut the chances of complaints prior to they happen to create e-commerce store with the help of experienced, skilled, and talented e-commerce web developers and designers.

posts.title: Improve Your WordPress Security With These Simple Tips
posts.content:
As we all know, WordPress is the most popular CMS on the Internet. This popularity is the reason many hackers target WordPress. WordPress Security has always been a big issue. WordPress itself provide some security, but that’s not enough. Those are basics. If you are using WordPress for your blog or any website, then you need to take some extra steps. These additional measures will help you to boost and improve your WordPress Security. I can’t guarantee you that taking these actions will secure your WordPress blog or website 100%. I can say that it will protect you from most of the attacks.

WordPress Security

  • Use Secure Hosting

Believe it or not. Hosting plays a vital role in the safety of your website or WordPress blog. If your hosting is secured, then you are one step more secure. Do a proper research before buying hosting for your blog. Make sure that your hosting providers always updates PHP and MySQL to latest version. Never use the older version of PHP and MySQL. The latest version has all the bug fixes and is safer than the previous version. Also, make sure your hosting has these features to keep your WordPress Security on top.

Read 5 Best Free WordPress Themes For Your Blog

  1. Account Isolation
  2. Web Application Firewall
  3. Intrusion detecting system

Always get the hosting from trusted companies like Bluehost, Hostgator, in motion,  and there are many others.

  • Limit file uploading from users

If you are running any blog or website that requires file upload from users. Then your WordPress is at significant risk. Users can upload any malicious file which can break or hack your  WordPress. If you are allowing users to upload a file, then limit the user from executing the files they upload. Get an SSL  for your website or blog for secure upload.  You can also use different transfer method like SSH, SFTH for users to upload an image.

  • Use Strong Passwords

Read: Top 5 Best SEO Plugins for Higher Ranking

One of the main reason, WordPress website or blog is hacked because of the bad password and username. There are many people and blogger who uses default username like admin for their blog. It’s a dangerous practice. Never use default username and password.Choose a secure username while installing WordPress. Change the password to something stronger. If you can’t remember it, then note it down somewhere safer. Keeping the same password for a longer period is also vulnerable for WordPress Security. Update your password regularly.

  • Backup Regularly

Backups are the major part of any security. Be it WordPress or any other things, backup is needed. You should backup your site on a weekly basis or monthly basis. If you are hacked and lost all of your data than you would have your backup to save you. You can use different WordPress plugins like Backup buddy or vault press to back up your website or blog. Even some hosting also provides backup services, utilise those services. Make your WordPress secure.

  • Always Be Updated

WordPress is a CMS software, and it is hackable. There can be many bugs and loopholes which help hacker to hack your WordPress blog. Updates fix those bugs and holes and save you from the hack. So always keep your WordPress updated. Not only CMS but also the plugins and themes you use on your blog or website. Never use the older version of any plugin or theme, they are vulnerable.

My Words

So these were the few tips to boost and improve your WordPress security. But these are only a few. There are many more steps you need to take to secure your blog. There is not anything called as 100% secured. So always keep an eye on the security of your blog. Keep maintaining your blog. Do regular scans. Ignoring the security can cause a great pain n your ass. You can get many other WordPress plugin that improves the safety, of those plugins.

If you have any more suggestions, tips, advice feels free to comment down below.
